item.title: Rosie Pattern Matching Language (RPL)
item.description: Simple associativity and precedence rules All RPL operators are right-associative expressions etc. Binary operators have equal precedence in RPL bracket expressions Brackets behave very much like parentheses and braces. It means that the expressions e1 â€¦ en can be any RPL expressions. It means that extra layers of brackets around an expression do not change its meaning. 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 -- a sequence of expressions (the pliers ie.
